page.title: 03Thornes Park,Wakefield(cont)
page.content: When asked some people felt the park was spoilt by litter, a big school centrally situated in it and the lack of more play facilities for young children. There are some interesting places in the park.{Holmfield House now provides refreshments, a conference centre and gardens and rockeries to sit in.{Thornes House, built between 1779 and 1781 for a wealth cloth merchant called{James {Milnes,}was partially burnt down in 1953 and now houses a school of the same name. Finally, Lowe Hill is a major feature of the park. Its local nickname is{"Cannonball Hill".}This is the second highest natural feature in Wakefield, the first being{Sandal {Castle Hill,}and was the site of an unlicensed motte and bailey castle.
